jobPostingInfo.title: Senior User Researcher & Designer
jobPostingInfo.jobDescription:
Job Details

New ideas are all around us, but only a few will change the world. That’s our focus at JPL. We ask the biggest questions, then search the universe for answers—literally. We build upon ideas that have guided generations, then share our discoveries to inspire generations to come. Your mission—your opportunity—is to seek out the answers that bring us one step closer. If you’re driven to discover, create, and inspire something that lasts a lifetime and beyond, you’re ready for JPL.

Located in Pasadena, California, JPL has a campus-like environment situated on 177 acres in the foothills of the San Gabriel Mountains and offers a work environment unlike any other: we inspire passion, foster innovation, build collaboration, and reward excellence.

Responsibilities:

We are looking for a Senior User Researcher & Designer (Senior Product Designer) to join the Human Systems Integration group at JPL to help infuse Human-Centered Design and Design Thinking into how we do systems engineering at JPL as part of the design team for Computer-Aided Engineering (CAE) organization. This position will uncover and make sense of complex relationships across different engineering disciplines that design and build spacecraft collaboratively for robotic space missions. The most critical contribution of this position will be to provide thought-provoking and/or actionable insights and inspire teams to address people’s needs through innovative design that people want to use.

While you functionally report to the Human Systems Integration group, you will be tasked to perform a number of projects. For this position, you will join the CAE design team and be reporting to the Design Team Lead.

As a Senior User Researcher & Designer (Senior Product Designer for CAE) you will work as part of the CAE design team to apply your craft to various products, services, and experiments. Other work will be speculative, generative explorations that you carry out in collaboration and partnership across the organization to flesh out, frame, and help prioritize solutions in an ever-evolving and complex, often ambiguous, problem space. You will drive out user experience strategy and execution for the Systems Environment product line in CAE. Its purpose is to help systems engineers design and build spacecraft with a modern engineering tooling environment and be more precise and faster.  We are responsible for developing and delivering tools, frameworks, products, and communities that support the needs of system engineers.

A successful candidate will perform the following tasks:

  • Simplify complex domain problems of Systems and SW Engineering at JPL by developing and refining the domain models
  • Identify gaps in our current understanding of practices and processes of Systems and SW Engineering at JPL in conjunction with CAE engineering and product management
  • Conduct user research with existing and potential customers.
  • Lead design thinking sessions to take advantage of everyone’s good ideas
  • Define the end-to-end user experience for a given product for Systems and SW Engineers at CAE.
  • Design all of the artifacts associated with the CAE products and product lines.
  • Partner with your engineering and product development partners to envision the strategy that ultimately shapes the future product offering of CAE.
  • Collaborate with other members of the design team to ensure a cohesive CAE experience

 In addition, as the Senior Product Designer, you will:

  • Collaborate cross-functionally with stakeholders and design to take products from concept to launch
  • Lead user experience design to help solve complex problems from concept to delivery in an agile environment
  • Learn continuously from the users through generative and evaluative research, and educate your product team on research practices & UX interview techniques
  • Research and synthesize user needs to help conceive, define, test, and evolve solutions for our users across various mediums and experiences
  • Verify and improve on low and high-fidelity designs through reviews, validations, and usability testing with end-users
  • Design and participate in co-creation design workshops with the design team and cross-disciplinary partners
  • Advocate for users and deliver user outcomes in a dynamic and agile work environment
  • Bring a systems-thinking lens to your design work
  • Help identify new opportunities to solve valuable user problems
  • Keep abreast of competitor products and industry trends
  • Define end to end workflows that tell simple user stories


Qualifications:

  • Typically requires a Bachelors with 6 years of related experience, Masters with 4 years of related experience, or PhD with 2 years of related experience. Education may be substituted with significant industry experience.
  • Proven understanding of UX research methods for enterprise tools
  • An understanding of enterprise system standard methodologies
  • A portfolio of design projects showing a strong human-centered approach and based on research
  • Experience organizing and moderating both individual research sessions and group research
  • Have a strong grasp of research methods and data analysis, both quantitative and qualitative
  • Excellent organizational, communication, interpersonal and teamwork skills
  • Storyboarding, wireframing, mockup and prototyping skills
  • Understanding of Agile Scrum practices and philosophies

JPL has a catalog of benefits and perks that span from the traditional to the unique. This includes a variety of health, dental, vision, wellbeing, and retirement plans, paid time off, learning, rideshare, childcare, flexible schedule, parental leave and many more. Our focus is on work-life balance, and living healthy, fulfilling lives as we Dare Mighty Things Together. For benefits eligible positions, benefits are effective the first day of the month coincident with or immediately following the employee’s start date.

For further benefits information click Benefits and Perks
